intro: Impatiens sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the warm seasons. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden beds. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its cultivation in horticultural settings.
